pullRequest.body:
New file `Nat/Prime/MersenneFermat.lean` contains the theorems: 

- Prime `a ^ n + 1` implies `n` is a power of two.
- `Fₙ = 2^(2^n)+1` is prime only if `3^(2^(2^n-1)) = -1 mod Fₙ` (Pépin's test).
- Prime factors of `a ^ (2 ^ n) + 1` are of form `k * 2 ^ (n + 1) + 1`.
- Prime factors of `Fₙ = 2 ^ (2 ^ n) + 1`, `1 < n`, are of form `k * 2 ^ (n + 2) + 1`.
- Prime factors of `Fₙ = 2 ^ (2 ^ n) + 1` are either 3, 5, or of form `k * 2 ^ (n + 2) + 1`.
- Prime `a ^ n - 1` implies `a = 2` and prime `n`.

Needs several imports from other modules so it was not wise to add it to `Prime/Basic`. 

    Co-authored-by: Thomas Browning <tb65536@uw.edu>

---

@tb65536 I finally decided to create a new file for this, as I wasn't able to disentangle `Nat.Prime` enough to avoid circular references.
Maybe `Archive`?

> Maybe `Archive`?

See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14049#issuecomment-2189447696
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
Can you please fix the title and the PR description? Also, these numbers are called "Fermat's prime", so I think also the name of the file should be changed.
I've heard them called "Fermat numbers" or "Fermat primes". Also, it could be worth generalizing to `a^n + 1` for `1 < a`.
Do we have the similar result about `a^n - 1` (if it is prime then `a=2` and `n` is prime)?

> Do we have the similar result about `a^n - 1` (if it is prime then `a=2` and `n` is prime)?

That's dealt with all the `Zmod` stuff, e.g. Fermat's little theorem. Would be surprised if not in Mathlib (and delighted to put it in).

> Can you please fix the title and the PR description? Also, these numbers are called "Fermat's prime", so I think also the name of the file should be changed.

What about the file name `Nat/Prime/PowAdd.lean`?

> > Do we have the similar result about `a^n - 1` (if it is prime then `a=2` and `n` is prime)?
> 
> That's dealt with all the `Zmod` stuff, e.g. Fermat's little theorem. Would be surprised if not in Mathlib (and delighted to put it in).

`a^(phi(n))-1` is Euler's theorem:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler%27s_theorem

> > > Do we have the similar result about `a^n - 1` (if it is prime then `a=2` and `n` is prime)?
> > 
> > 
> > That's dealt with all the `Zmod` stuff, e.g. Fermat's little theorem. Would be surprised if not in Mathlib (and delighted to put it in).
> 
> `a^(phi(n))-1` is Euler's theorem: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euler%27s_theorem

That's not what I am talking about: if `a ^ n - 1` is a prime then `a = 2` and `n` is a prime.

The (poly multiplication) proof is shown in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mersenne_prime
Some things seem to be in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/8666bd82efec40b8b3a5abca02dc9b24bbdf2652/Mathlib/NumberTheory/LucasLehmer.lean

That would fit very much here, maybe I can get to it this afternoon.

> Do we have the similar result about `a^n - 1` (if it is prime then `a=2` and `n` is prime)?

Maybe Mersenne's prime?

I think it's best if some more results can be added, for example,
- factors of `2^(2^n)+1` must be of form `k *2^(n+2) + 1`
- [Pépin's test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P%C3%A9pin%27s_test)
Would `MersenneFermat` or `FermatMersenne` be a better name for the title of the file?

This was ready for review again since October 1st, I just forgot to remove the awaiting-author label...
@Ruben-VandeVelde

LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11797338341/job/32861140981)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11797338341/job/32861141419)
maintainer merge

Here's a golf:
```
theorem prime_of_pow_sub_one_prime {a n : ℕ} (hn1 : n ≠ 1) (hP : (a ^ n - 1).Prime) :
    a = 2 ∧ n.Prime := by
  have han1 : 1 < a ^ n := tsub_pos_iff_lt.mp hP.pos
  have hn0 : n ≠ 0 := fun h ↦ (h ▸ han1).ne' rfl
  have ha1 : 1 < a := (Nat.one_lt_pow_iff hn0).mp han1
  have ha0 : 0 < a := one_pos.trans ha1
  have ha2 : a = 2 := by
    contrapose! hn1
    have h := nat_sub_dvd_pow_sub_pow a 1 n
    rw [one_pow, hP.dvd_iff_eq (mt (Nat.sub_eq_iff_eq_add ha1.le).mp hn1), eq_comm] at h
    exact (pow_eq_self_iff ha1).mp (Nat.sub_one_cancel ha0 (pow_pos ha0 n) h).symm
  subst ha2
  refine ⟨rfl, Nat.prime_def_lt''.mpr ⟨(two_le_iff n).mpr ⟨hn0, hn1⟩, fun d hdn ↦ ?_⟩⟩
  have hinj : ∀ x y, 2 ^ x - 1 = 2 ^ y - 1 → x = y :=
    fun x y h ↦ Nat.pow_right_injective le_rfl (sub_one_cancel (pow_pos ha0 x) (pow_pos ha0 y) h)
  have h := nat_sub_dvd_pow_sub_pow (2 ^ d) 1 (n / d)
  rw [one_pow, ← pow_mul, Nat.mul_div_cancel' hdn] at h
  exact (hP.eq_one_or_self_of_dvd (2 ^ d - 1) h).imp (hinj d 1) (hinj d n)
```

Here's a golf:
```suggestion
  replace ha : 1 < a ^ 2 ^ k := one_lt_pow (pow_ne_zero k two_ne_zero) ha
  have h := hm.nat_add_dvd_pow_add_pow (a ^ 2 ^ k) 1
  rw [one_pow, hP.dvd_iff_eq (Nat.lt_add_right 1 ha).ne', add_left_inj, pow_eq_self_iff ha] at h
  rw [h, mul_one]
```

Here's a golf:
```suggestion
  rw [not_forall]
  use 5
  have : 641 * 6700417 = 2 ^ 2 ^ 5 + 1 := by norm_num
  apply Nat.not_prime_mul' this <;> norm_num
```

Another option worth considering would be to split out
```
theorem not_prime_fermat_five : ¬ Nat.Prime (2 ^ (2 ^ 5) + 1) := by
  have : 641 * 6700417 = 2 ^ 2 ^ 5 + 1 := by norm_num
  apply Nat.not_prime_mul' this <;> norm_num
```
Done. Crazy golfing!
You should swap these, so that `not_prime_fermat_five` can be used to prove `not_all_pow_pow_add_prime`
Done.

```suggestion
theorem pow_of_pow_add_prime {a n : ℕ} (ha : 1 < a) (hn : 1 < n) (hP : Prime (a ^ n + 1)) :
```
Or maybe `(a ^ n + 1).Prime`.
Does your suggestion get the right `Prime`?
I don't know indeed, but my guess is that is the same proof works then yes (`(...).Prime` should).
Done. Thanks for all your reviewing work!
I am not sure we really want these in mathlib: the point of the counterexample is that Euler proved it using quadratic reciprocity: doing it by brute force seems of little interest.
So I should remove them?
I think so.
Done.

```suggestion
theorem pow_of_pow_add_prime {a n : ℕ} (ha : 1 < a) (hn : 1 < n) (hP : (a ^ n + 1).Prime) :
```

```suggestion
theorem pow_of_pow_add_prime {a n : ℕ} (ha : 1 < a) (hn : n ≠ 0) (hP : (a ^ n + 1).Prime) :
    ∃ m : ℕ, n = 2 ^ m := by
  obtain ⟨k, m, hm, rfl⟩ := exists_eq_two_pow_mul_odd hn
```
Can you split out `∃ k, p = k * 2 ^ (n + 1) + 1` as a separate lemma without the `1 < n` assumption?
Generalized. I made the original private, or do you really want two?
I think it's fine to have two. A stronger version with the `1 < n` assumption and a weaker version without.

Does this generalize to `p ∣ a ^ (2 ^ n) + 1 → ∃ k, p = k * 2 ^ (n + 1) + 1`? I think you can deduce the stronger `a = 2` version from this by applying the general result once to get `p % 8 = 1`, writing `(2 : ZMod p) = m ^ 2`, and reapplying the general result to `p ∣ m ^ (2 ^ (n + 1)) + 1`.
Maybe. However, my real job strangles me positively at the moment. I'd prefer that this file be merged first, before I start going into this.

It's probably worth including it in this PR since it shortens the proof (since you only need to make the `orderOf` argument once rather than twice) and generalizes the result.
```
lemma lem1 {a n p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (hp2 : p ≠ 2) (hpdvd : p ∣ a ^ (2 ^ n) + 1) :
    ∃ k, p = k * 2 ^ (n + 1) + 1 := by
  have : Fact (2 < p) := Fact.mk (lt_of_le_of_ne hp.two_le hp2.symm)
  have : Fact p.Prime := Fact.mk hp
  have ha1 : (a : ZMod p) ^ (2 ^ n) = -1 := by
    rw [eq_neg_iff_add_eq_zero]
    exact_mod_cast (natCast_zmod_eq_zero_iff_dvd (a ^ (2 ^ n) + 1) p).mpr hpdvd
  have ha0 : (a : ZMod p) ≠ 0 := by
    intro h
    rw [h, zero_pow (pow_ne_zero n two_ne_zero), zero_eq_neg] at ha1
    exact one_ne_zero ha1
  have ha : orderOf (a : ZMod p) = 2 ^ (n + 1) := by
    apply orderOf_eq_prime_pow
    · rw [ha1]
      exact ZMod.neg_one_ne_one
    · rw [pow_succ, pow_mul, ha1, neg_one_sq]
  simpa [ha, dvd_def, Nat.sub_eq_iff_eq_add hp.one_le, mul_comm] using orderOf_dvd_card_sub_one ha0

lemma lem2 {n p : ℕ} (hn : 1 < n) (hp : p.Prime) (hpdvd : p ∣ 2 ^ (2 ^ n) + 1) :
    ∃ k, p = k * 2 ^ (n + 2) + 1 := by
  have : Fact p.Prime := Fact.mk hp
  have hp2 : p ≠ 2 := by
    exact ((even_pow.mpr ⟨even_two, pow_ne_zero n two_ne_zero⟩).add_one).ne_two_of_dvd_nat hpdvd
  have hp8 : p % 8 = 1 := by
    obtain ⟨k, rfl⟩ := lem1 hp hp2 hpdvd
    obtain ⟨n, rfl⟩ := Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le' hn
    rw [add_assoc, pow_add, ← mul_assoc, ← mod_add_mod, mul_mod]
    norm_num
  obtain ⟨a, ha⟩ := (exists_sq_eq_two_iff hp2).mpr (Or.inl hp8)
  suffices h : p ∣ a.val ^ (2 ^ (n + 1)) + 1 by
    exact lem1 hp hp2 h
  rw [← natCast_zmod_eq_zero_iff_dvd, Nat.cast_add, Nat.cast_one, Nat.cast_pow] at hpdvd ⊢
  rwa [ZMod.natCast_val, ZMod.cast_id, pow_succ', pow_mul, sq, ← ha]
```
Great, thanks!

```suggestion
  have := Fact.mk (succ_lt_succ (Nat.one_lt_pow (pow_ne_zero n two_ne_zero) one_lt_two))
  have key : 2 ^ n = 2 ^ n - 1 + 1 := (Nat.sub_add_cancel Nat.one_le_two_pow).symm
  apply lucas_primality (p := 2 ^ (2 ^ n) + 1) (a := 3)
  · rw [Nat.add_sub_cancel, key, pow_succ, pow_mul, ← pow_succ, ← key, h, neg_one_sq]
  · intro p hp1 hp2
    rw [Nat.add_sub_cancel, (Nat.prime_dvd_prime_iff_eq hp1 prime_two).mp (hp1.dvd_of_dvd_pow hp2),
        key, pow_succ, Nat.mul_div_cancel _ two_pos, ← pow_succ, ← key, h]
    exact ZMod.neg_one_ne_one
```

```suggestion
/-- Prime factors of `a ^ (2 ^ n) + 1` are of form `k * 2 ^ (n + 1) + 1`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- `Fₙ = 2^(2^n)+1` is prime only if `3^(2^(2^n-1)) = -1 mod Fₙ` (**Pépin's test**). -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Prime `a ^ n + 1` implies `n` is a power of two (**Fermat primes**). -/
```
Probably these should all go into the `Nat` namespace; sorry for not catching that earlier.
Put them in a Nat namespace and moved them to the new `Fermat.lean` after talking with @rwst

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Nat/Prime): Primality of some numbers of form `a^n±1`
